properties.Name: LifeInsuranceFraudType
properties.Description:
Fraud is an act of deceit, misstatement, misrepresentation of a material face made knowingly with the ultimate intention being to expose the Insurer to potential loss or suffer a potential financial hardship.

With life insurance contracts, an insurer has only a limited period of  time to challenge the validity of the contract.    After that period, the insurer cannot contest the policy or deny benefits based on material misrepresentations, concealment or fraud.

Ex:
- Age Misstatement
- Concealment
- Sex Misstatement

AGE MISSTATEMENT
The  misstatement of the  age of the  Insured.

Normally the  benefit payable is adjusted to what the  premiums paid should have purchased.

CONCEALMENT
The  failure of the  Insured to disclose to the  Insured a material fact relevant to the  acceptance of risk at the  time that the  application is made.

SEX MISSTATEMENT
The  misstatement of the  sex of the  Insured.

Normally the  benefit payable is adjusted to what the  premiums paid should have purchased.

Columns.Name: LifeInsuranceFraudTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Life Insurance Fraud Type.

Columns.Name: LifeInsuranceFraudTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of the Life Insurance Fraud Type.

Columns.Name: LifeInsuranceFraudTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the Life Insurance Fraud Type.
